questions.title: Question 1
questions.question: What is Economics?
options: The study of markets and trading only
The study of how societies allocate scarce resources
The study of human behavior and psychology
The study of how to create money and wealth

questions.title: Question 2
questions.question: What is the primary focus of Microeconomics?
options: The behavior of individual markets and firms
The study of inflation and unemployment
The analysis of national economic growth
The allocation of resources in a global context

questions.title: Question 3
questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a positive economic statement?
options: The government should reduce taxes to increase spending
Higher taxes lead to lower consumer spending
Inflation is bad for the economy
The minimum wage ought to be increased

questions.title: Question 4
questions.question: What is meant by opportunity cost?
options: The total cost of producing goods
The cost of choosing one alternative over another
The amount of money required to invest in a project
The profit made from a business decision

questions.title: Question 5
questions.question: In a perfectly competitive market, firms are:
options: Price takers
Price makers
Monopolies
Cartels
